intro: Enneastemon nigritanus, commonly known as the blackstem false heather, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its dark green leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers add ornamental value, while its compact growth habit makes it ideal for rock gardens or as a ground cover.
